title: Bachelorette's Warwick Adams proves he didn't ghost Angie Kent with snap of goodbye hug
text:
He appeared to quit The Bachelorette without saying goodbye to Angie Kent on Thursday night's episode.

But on Sunday, Warwick Adams, 36, exposed the reality show's editing fail by sharing a picture of himself hugging the blonde bombshell goodbye.

The photo, which was previously published by Daily Mail Australia, shows the construction supervisor embracing Angie as he gets into a car outside the mansion.

The Bachelorette editing fail: Warwick Adams (right) proved he didn't 'ghost' Angie Kent (left), uploading a snap of himself hugging the blonde bombshell goodbye on Sunday

'When you 'ghost' the Bachelorette,' Warwick captioned the Instagram post.

A camera man can be seen filming the whole interaction, but it appears the goodbye scene did not make the final edit.

Thursday night's episode suggested the Perth man stormed out of the mansion without even informing Angie of his intention to quit.

Stitched up? Warwick shared evidence exposing the show on Instagram. 'When you 'ghost' the Bachelorette,' he captioned the post

Surprised? 'I was looking around at all the faces and I was like 'where's Warwick?'' Angie said in the episode, before accusing the Perth man of 'ghosting' her

Angie seemed to be surprised when she arrived at the cocktail party and was 'informed' by the other contestants of Warwick's departure.

'I was looking around at all the faces and I was like 'where's Warwick?'' she said.

'There's a warning for you ladies! Even the Bachelorette can get ghosted!'

Earlier in the episode, many contestants were invited on a photo-shoot group date where they dressed like farm animals and Angie was dressed like a farmer.

What a chicken! The Bachelorette's Warwick Adams (pictured) quit the show after storming off a photo shoot dressed as a farmyard animal

Not funny? Warwick, who dressed up as a chicken for a farm themed shoot, wasn't impressed when the other suitors joked about his costume

After slipping into a chicken costume, the Perth man flew into a rage when his rivals poked fun of his attire, claiming they had 'gone too far' and he was 'f***ing over it'.

Warwick tore off the costume and stormed off from the date, before informing fellow contestants that he was leaving before the cocktail party.

'As soon as I got handed the chicken, I just feel like it's not the way that I'm gonna meet the person that I will fall in love with in my life,' he announced.
description: He appeared to quit The Bachelorette without saying goodbye to Angie Kent on Thursday night's episode.
authors: Shive Prema For Daily Mail Australia
